title: Triumph of the Will
creator_credit: Leni Riefenstahl-Produktion, Reichspropagandaleitung der NSDAP, Walter Ruttmann, Eberhard Taubert and Leni Riefenstahl
brief_description: Filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl’s controversial masterwork is an artful work of propaganda showcasing German chancellor and Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler at the 1934 Nuremberg Rally. Edited from over 60 hours’ worth of raw footage shot over the course of the rally’s four days, the film is visually remarkable in the way it captures the event’s enormous scale.

constellations_other.name: The war effort on film
constellations_other.description: Newsreel and documentaries were used as propaganda for the war effort by all sides during WWII, many of them made by major film studios, directors and actors.
